item.title: Fei-Fei Li picks Google Cloud, where she led AI, as World Labs’ main compute provider
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Cloud providers are chasing after AI unicorns, and the latest is Fei-Fei Li’s World Labs. The startup just tapped Google Cloud as its primary compute provider to train AI models, a deal that could be worth hundreds of millions of dollars. But Li’s tenure as chief scientist of AI at Google Cloud wasn’t a factor, […]

item.title: The White House joins Reddit and shares hurricane information
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
VP Kamala Harris is on the “Call Her Daddy” podcast, FEMA has a page dedicated to fighting the rumors circulating on social media about the hurricanes, and now the White House is on Reddit. It’s clear that the traditional means of disseminating news and information to the general U.S. population have changed. As a big […]

item.title: On TikTok, pop culture prevails over news and politics
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
TikTok is growing fast as a destination for news, but news and politics accounts make up less than one percent of accounts followed by U.S. adults, the Pew Research Center says. Around half of all TikTok accounts followed by U.S. adults are influencers and creators, the study shows. Plus, content related to news and politics […]

item.title: Tesla Robotaxi reveal: What to expect
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Tesla is gearing up to reveal its Robotaxi this Thursday, and everyone wants to know what it will look like, whether Tesla will unveil a commercialization strategy, and what outrageous timelines Elon Musk might announce to bump Tesla’s stock.  The “We, Robot” event will take place at 7 p.m. PT at Warner Bros. Discovery’s movie […]

item.title: AI mortgage startup LoanSnap loses license to operate in Connecticut
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
The revocation comes after TechCrunch's exclusive reporting on how LoanSnap was inundated with lawsuits.

item.title: Fourteen AGs sue TikTok, claiming that it harms children’s mental health
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Fourteen U.S. attorneys general sued TikTok on Tuesday, alleging that the platform negatively impacts minors’ mental health and harvests data without their consent. TikTok, a U.S. company owned by the Chinese conglomerate ByteDance, is embroiled in a number of lawsuits that could threaten its operations. In another recent lawsuit, the FTC and the Justice Department […]

item.title: North American robotics sales declined in first half of 2024
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Even a category as hot as robotics is not immune from macroeconomic trends. According to figures from automation advocacy group, A3, the North American robotics market declined in the first half of 2024, both in terms of sales and revenue. The number of industrial robotics ordered in H1 declined 7.5% year-over-year to 15,705. Revenue dipped […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Code in Meta’s Threads app references a communities feature, similar to Elon Musk’s X
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta’s take on a Twitter/X rival, Instagram Threads, may be inching further into its competitor’s territory with the development of a communities feature that would presumably allow users to better organize their discussions on the platform by topics. At least that’s what references in the app’s code seem to imply. The code mentions a new […]

item.title: Ex Google Maps team members get Sequoia backing to build an AI-powered collaboration board
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
When you talk to a chatbot like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini, your responses are largely linear. You often have to ask follow-up questions to get more information. For instance, when you are planning a trip, you might first ask the chatbot about the place and follow it up with questions on meal planning, activities, tips […]

item.title: Unify, an OpenAI Converge accelerator grad, lands $12M for ‘warm outbound’ messages
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Unify, an AI-powered startup that uses data to reach prospective buyers, has raised a $12 million Series A led by existing investors Emergence Capital and Thrive Capital. OpenAI Startup Fund, Neo, Abstract, 20Sales, and AltCap also participated in the round. The 20-month-old company went through OpenAI’s Converge I accelerator last year and, following that program, […]

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Announcing True Anomaly, Slingshot Aerospace, and Space Workforce 2030 at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
As government and defense sectors increasingly lean on commercial services, opportunities for startups in dual-use technology have never been more promising. Yet, for young, agile companies, the challenge of entering such a highly regulated and traditional landscape is significant. How can emerging businesses compete with established primes for contracts and attention? And how can investors […]

item.title: Kaspersky says it’s closing down its UK office and laying off dozens
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Russian cybersecurity giant Kaspersky is shutting down its office in the United Kingdom and laying off its staff, just three months after the company started closing down its U.S. operations and laying off dozens of workers, TechCrunch has learned.  Kaspersky spokesperson Francesco Tius said in an email to TechCrunch that the company “will commence a […]

item.title: Fisker bankruptcy hits major speed bump as fleet sale is now in question
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Fisker’s Chapter 11 bankruptcy has hit a major snag, as the company buying the startup’s remaining fleet of electric SUVs says it might not complete the purchase because of a surprising technical issue. The buyer, a New York-area leasing company called American Lease, says in a new filing that Fisker now believes there is no […]

item.title: Alaska Airlines’ venture lab spins out its first startup: Odysee
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Odysee CEO Steve Casley sees dollar signs in data. Or more specifically, AI-powered software that can analyze reams of data to help commercial airlines get the most out of its complex flight schedules. Odysee, the first startup born out of an aviation-focused venture lab formed by Alaska Airlines and UP.Labs, is doing just that. The […]

item.title: The New York Times is testing a new game called Zorse
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
The New York Times is working to expand its ever successful gaming section with Zorse, a game the company is testing in beta. Per a report in Semafor, this will be a phrase-guessing game where each puzzle is a mashup of two phrases. You know, like a Zorse — a zebra horse. Gaming has been […]

item.title: Snapchat is bringing ads to the Chat tab
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Snapchat is bringing ads to the app’s main Chat tab, the company announced on Tuesday. Up until now, Snapchat has kept the Chat tab free from ads, but users will now start to see “Sponsored Snaps” from advertisers alongside messages from their friends. Users won’t be notified about Sponsored Snaps and will be able to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Honda gave us a sneak peek of its 0 Series EVs — here’s what we learned
item.dc:creator: Emme Hall
item.description:
For years, Honda has relied on hybrids — not so much EVs — to drive its electrified mission. All of that is about to change with the Honda 0 Series, a portfolio of new electric vehicles that will go into production over the next several years. Honda has been teasing the Series 0 EVs since […]

item.title: Gropyus plans to use robots to help rebuild Ukraine better and faster
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Construction tech startup Groypus has raised $100 million to scale up its factory that uses robots to make buildings 30% faster than traditional methods.

item.title: X rival Mastodon rolls out revamped notifications, a refreshed look, and more
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Mastodon, the open source, decentralized alternative to X (formerly Twitter), is rolling out a handful of new features, including refreshed notifications, new discovery tools, and an updated look. Although some of these changes were available in nightly releases, they are now officially rolling out in a stable release. Notifications on Mastodon will now look somewhat similar to […]
